thread.title: Onyx Biotec shares debut at 11% discount on NSE SME platform today - The Economic Times
thread.title_full: Onyx Biotec shares debut at 11% discount on NSE SME platform today - The Economic Times

author: Nishtha Awasthi
title: Onyx Biotec shares debut at 11% discount on NSE SME platform today - The Economic Times
text: Shares of Onyx Biotec debuted on the NSE SME platform on Friday, listing at Rs 54.05, a discount of 11.4% over the upper price band of Rs 61 set by the company.The companyâ€™s IPO was entirely a fresh equity sale of 48.1 lakh shares and through the issue, the company intended to raise about Rs 29 crore.The net proceeds from the public offer will be used for the upgradation of the existing manufacturing unit to manufacture large volume parentals for intravenous use, setting up a high-speed cartooning packaging line at the existing manufacturing unit, repayment of debt, and general corporate purposes.The company was offering its shares at Rs 58-61 apiece, and investors could bid for 2,000 shares in 1 lot.In the unlisted market, ahead of the listing, the company's shares were trading with a GMP of Rs 15, indicating a premium of 23% over the issue price.Onyx started its operation in the pharmaceutical industry with sterile water for injections in the year 2010. Since then, the company has been associated with the healthcare segment and offering Sterile Pharmaceutical products and has become a prominent supplier of sterile products to major corporations, which includes the top pharma companies at pan India level.Also read: Adani Group stocks extend losses, drop up to 11% after Kenya cancels deals following US chargesOnyx currently manufactures Sterile Water for Injections and acts as a pharmaceutical contract manufacturer offering a comprehensive range of Dry Powder Injections and Dry Syrup for India and overseas.For the period ended May 2024, the company clocked total revenues of Rs 10.52 crore and net profit of Rs 1.3 crore.The shares of Onyx Biotec were trading 5% higher at Rs 56.75 on the NSE around 10:45 am today.(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of The Economic Times)
